title: What are some good books about the future of mankind? - Quora

response.answer_text: I have a lot of books about the future, but the ones that seem to be about both future and mankind are: Notes from the Holocene (I haven’t read i t) and Throwing rocks at the Google bus: how growth became the enemy of prosperity/Douglas Rushkoff. Books on the future: about sf: What makes this book so great/Jo Walton Ten billion tomorrows about predicting the future: Nicholas Rescher/Predicting the future The future of everything: the science of prediction/D. Orrell/2007 Fortune Sellers (note spelling) / William A. Sheridan Futurehype/Max Dublin/he’s skeptical about futurology Future of jobs: Job market of the future/James Cooke Brown Only humans need apply/Thomas H. Davenport/about computers augmenting, not replacing, humans Rise of the robots Industries of the future Future of x: Childhood’s future/A. Louv Why we drive…the future of automobiles The fate of reading in a digital world Prosperity lost: the decline of families & the rise of progress What’s next: dispatches on the future of science/Max Brockman The end of faith: the future of reason/Sam Harris Misc. Fewer: how the new demography will shape our future But what if we’re wrong?/Klosterman Triumph of the mundane/trends What the future holds: insights from the social sciences/2002/Cooper, R. & Layard
response.upvotes: Answer requested by Roger Paul Luca

response.answer_text: Thanks for the A2A. Check out the books by these famous authors and hopefully you’ll like what is up to your expectation. Since there are tons of books on the future of mankind it is very hard for anyone to suggest a particular book(s).
